# Literacy Development

- A veces es un poco difícil justificar la inclusión de literatura en el aula 

- Realmente no concuerda con "real life" contextos

  - es bastante abstracto (historically, geographically, socially, culturally, linguistically, etc)
  
- La pregunta es: 
  
  - ¿Qué hacer con la literatura? (o... ¿why do anything with it at all...?)

# Literacy Development

.pull-left[
- Cultural enrichment

- Linguistic model

- Mental training

- Extension of linguistic competence

- Authenticity

.pull-right[

- Memorability

- Rhythmic resource

- Motivating material

-Open to interpretation

- Convenience
]

# Como incorporar la literatura en el aula

- Usar cuentos conocidos/famosos

  - Pretérito vs imperfecto: Ricitos de oro y los tres osos

- Hacer actividades antes de leer 
  
  - Vocabulario / contexto / etc.
  
- NewsELA: https://newsela.com/ 

  - Lexile levels
  
- Preguntas de comprensión vs de discusión 

---
# How to select the right text

- Is the text an appropriate reading level for students? 

- Will the text capture the students' interest?

- Do students need prior/background knowledge to comprehend the text?

- Is the text culturally relevant & engaging?

---

# Writing Strategies and Writer's workshop

- Writing is a **process** and it will likely take multiple attempts and revisions

- Don't rush the process, allow students to revise, reflect, and refine writing multiple times

- Use self-reflection rubrics to help students self-evaluate and monitor their progress

- Use peer and teacher conferencing to strengthen original writing sample
